verses.kjv: And the whole earth was of one language, and of one speech.
verses.ct: The entire earth shared a single language and a common vocabulary.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there.
verses.ct: As people migrated from the east, they discovered a flat plain in the land of Shinar and settled there.

verses.kjv: And they said one to another, Go to, let us make brick, and burn them thoroughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for morter.
verses.ct: They told each other, "Come, let us make bricks and fire them until they are hard." So they used brick instead of stone, and tar instead of mortar.

verses.kjv: And they said, Go to, let us build us a city and a tower, whose top may reach unto heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.
verses.ct: Then they said, "Come, let us build ourselves a city with a tower that reaches up to heaven. Let us make a name for ourselves, so that we won't be scattered across the whole earth."

verses.kjv: And the LORD came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.
verses.ct: The LORD came down to observe the city and the tower that the people had constructed.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, Behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.
verses.ct: The LORD said, "Look, these people are united and all speak one language. This is only the beginning of what they will do. Soon nothing they plan will be impossible for them."

verses.kjv: Go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.
verses.ct: "Come, let us go down and mix up their language so that none of them can understand what the others are saying."

verses.kjv: So the LORD scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off to build the city.
verses.ct: So the LORD scattered them from that place across the whole earth, and they stopped building the city.

verses.kjv: Therefore is the name of it called Babel; because the LORD did there confound the language of all the earth: and from thence did the LORD scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.
verses.ct: That is why it was named Babel, because there the LORD confused the language of the entire earth. From that place, the LORD dispersed them over the surface of the whole earth.

verses.kjv: These are the generations of Shem: Shem was an hundred years old, and begat Arphaxad two years after the flood:
verses.ct: This is the account of Shem's descendants. When Shem was a hundred years old, he became the father of Arphaxad, two years after the flood.

verses.kjv: And Shem lived after he begat Arphaxad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.ct: After Arphaxad was born, Shem lived another five hundred years and had other sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: And Arphaxad lived five and thirty years, and begat Salah:
verses.ct: When Arphaxad was thirty-five years old, he became the father of Salah.

verses.kjv: And Arphaxad lived after he begat Salah four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.ct: After Salah was born, Arphaxad lived another four hundred and three years and had other sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: And Salah lived thirty years, and begat Eber:
verses.ct: When Salah was thirty years old, he became the father of Eber.

verses.kjv: And Salah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.ct: After Eber was born, Salah lived another four hundred and three years and had other sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: And Eber lived four and thirty years, and begat Peleg:
verses.ct: When Eber was thirty-four years old, he became the father of Peleg.

verses.kjv: And Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.ct: After Peleg was born, Eber lived another four hundred and thirty years and had other sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:
verses.ct: When Peleg was thirty years old, he became the father of Reu.

verses.kjv: And Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.ct: After Reu was born, Peleg lived another two hundred and nine years and had other sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: And Reu lived two and thirty years, and begat Serug:
verses.ct: When Reu was thirty-two years old, he became the father of Serug.

verses.kjv: And Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.ct: After Serug was born, Reu lived another two hundred and seven years and had other sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: And Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor:
verses.ct: When Serug was thirty years old, he became the father of Nahor.

verses.kjv: And Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.ct: After Nahor was born, Serug lived another two hundred years and had other sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah:
verses.ct: When Nahor was twenty-nine years old, he became the father of Terah.

verses.kjv: And Nahor lived after he begat Terah an hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.
verses.ct: After Terah was born, Nahor lived another hundred and nineteen years and had other sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: And Terah lived seventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
verses.ct: When Terah was seventy years old, he became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

verses.kjv: Now these are the generations of Terah: Terah begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begat Lot.
verses.ct: This is the account of Terah's family. Terah was the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran. Haran was the father of Lot.

verses.kjv: And Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his nativity, in Ur of the Chaldees.
verses.ct: Haran died during his father Terah's lifetime, in the land where he was born, in Ur of the Chaldees.

verses.kjv: And Abram and Nahor took them wives: the name of Abram’s wife was Sarai; and the name of Nahor’s wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah.
verses.ct: Both Abram and Nahor married. Abram's wife was named Sarai, and Nahor's wife was named Milcah. Milcah was the daughter of Haran, who was the father of both Milcah and Iscah.

verses.kjv: But Sarai was barren; she had no child.
verses.ct: Sarai, however, was unable to have children; she had no child.

verses.kjv: And Terah took Abram his son, and Lot the son of Haran his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter in law, his son Abram’s wife; and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan; and they came unto Haran, and dwelt there.
verses.ct: Terah took his son Abram, his grandson Lot who was Haran's son, and his daughter-in-law Sarai, the wife of Abram. Together they departed from Ur of the Chaldees, intending to travel to the land of Canaan. But when they reached Haran, they settled there.

verses.kjv: And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years: and Terah died in Haran.
verses.ct: Terah lived to be two hundred and five years old, and he died in Haran.
